title: I've had enough of people banning your champs in champion select. Why is it even allowed?
body:
Over the course of my last year of playing this game, I've had people constantly banning Yasuo even when I hadn't done anything wrong. I'M FREAKING HONOR 5, I almost never flame, and I play my own goddamn game. I submitted a ticket to riot player report and all they had to say was o sorry we can't do anything about the dodges you've made for your team against a troll or whatnot. I even saw it happen to another player and all I could do was watch him suffer, these players don't even apologize in any situation (unless they've truly made a mistake). Why do we not have a kick system so that players can vote to kick the troll in champion select. This would lower the chances of trolls affecting games by a large amount. Look I don't mind if you think Yasuo is broken or OP, but if you think banning your own teammate out is going to win you the game then clearly you're not mature enough to play the game. There needs to be something done, or at least riot needs to listen to pleads with hard evidence.
Thanks, 
Botlinebling

replies.body:
Because at some point you have to decide between "everyone gets to ban whatever champion they want" and "everyone gets to play whatever champion they want."

Since there are other games where you can play anything you want (blind pick), Riot has chosen to allow players to avoid situations they find personally frustrating or characters they have no fun playing against/with. Both options have downsides and trolling potential, and they had to choose one side to favor.

If that really is the truth then why isn't there a ranked version for blind pick?
Anyhow I'd like to retract my title, but my description doesn't talk about getting rid of the bans players get, it's about the fact that players troll and if they don't get a certain role, speaking from pure experience, they ban their teammate out. What I'm requesting is someway to remove the trolls before the game begins like a unanimous vote to kick the person holding champ select hostage.
-Botlinebling

> [{quoted}](name=BotLineBling,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=amjroVQR,comment-id=00010000,timestamp=2017-12-31T17:49:22.974+0000)If that really is the truth then why isn't there a ranked version for blind pick?

Because Ranked is already a smaller community of players. No reason to split it further. It's entirely opt-in, and if you don't want to deal with banning then play Blind Pick.

>What I'm requesting is someway to remove the trolls before the game begins like a unanimous vote to kick the person holding champ select hostage.

The problem with this is that it's super exploitable. What if I want to play something unique and no one wants me to? Say I'm honestly REALLY GOOD at mid-Teemo. I somehow manage to win 75% of games with him, and I one-trick him. Suddenly I can never find a game because people keep voting to kick me for playing something not part of the "best" meta.

It enforces meta picks FAR more than troll-banning does, because it gives teams the ability to pick and choose their teammates based on the champions they play.

Honestly, It's hard to believe when you say that the ranked community is smaller, but since you're a mod i trust it. Then what do you suggest, I was just throwing out an idea, apparently reporting them to riot is the correct choice, I'm stuck as to what comes further on. I don't think it's right and when it does happen in champ select the thing left to do is dodge and hope you're not stuck with another player as such? I have a dodge penalty of about 10 lp after all I've done, and people just refuse to dodge. If you do reply and disagree I think you should have an idea to refute what I had considered.
Thanks,
-Botlinebling

> [{quoted}](name=BotLineBling,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=amjroVQR,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-31T18:18:03.143+0000)Honestly, It's hard to believe when you say that the ranked community is smaller, but since you're a mod i trust it. 

Don't trust me -- trust the statistics. [There are about 1.9 million ranked players in NA last season.](http://na.op.gg/statistics/tier/).But we also know that NA is one of the largest servers, and *League* has between 75 and 100 million monthly players.

So even if NA is just 20% of the total that's still about 15-20 million players, meaning about 1/10 play Ranked.

>If you do reply and disagree I think you should have an idea to refute what I had considered.

I agree it's frustrating. But the opposite (having allies able to troll-hover powerful picks to let your enemies snag them and prevent you from banning them) is also super frustrating. There's no good solution, but this way at least there ARE game modes where you can play what you want, so you have options.

Since Ranked is entirely opt-in, the fact that it has one or two potentially negative experiences in terms of what you can/can't play is much more acceptable, as you CHOOSE to participate in a game mode where that can happen. I happen to think that's fine, and if someone is banning your champion malevolently than report them -- that's what the system is there for.

> [{quoted}](name=The Djinn,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=amjroVQR,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-31T18:35:17.590+0000)
>

> Since Ranked is entirely opt-in, the fact that it has one or two potentially negative experiences in terms of what you can/can't play is much more acceptable, as you CHOOSE to participate in a game mode where that can happen. I happen to think that's fine, and if someone is banning your champion malevolently than report them -- that's what the system is there for.


What about playing draft modes so that you don't have to play with a particular champion? I often ban Zoe if we don't have first pick. Infact, I ban her 100% of the time of we don't have first pick because playing against her is my own personal feeling of helpless hell. Will I be punished for banning something that I legitimately have a hard time playing against even though I am in a mode that allows me to do so? ( And that my ban is strategic rather than with malice to anyone who has her hovered?) Or....doesn't it make more sense that if people want to play FOTM they take blinds?

> [{quoted}](name=Broken Bandle,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=amjroVQR,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-12-31T20:41:00.495+0000)Will I be punished for banning something that I legitimately have a hard time playing against even though I am in a mode that allows me to do so?

No. Never. You are 100% allowed to ban whatever you want to ban.
Glad to know getting reported for banning the champion I want to ban won't result in weird punishments :)

This isn't about being able to ban a champion it's about being a toxic player and banning a champ someone has hovered, without asking them or communicating, so if you do ban a champ like that, you do deserve a ban :)

Nah fam, nah. 

Regardless of hovering, I have every right to ban whatever I want. Whether I choose to engage or not engage with strangers who may or may not be toxic about what I want to ban is up to me.

Thankfully Riot has my back on this issue.

If it's of such huge concern for you... just don't hover your champ. I'll continue to ban what I want to ban and you'll know that it wasn't solely because you hovered it, but because I didn't want it in the game.

There's always another match. Always blind pick. Always customs. If your champ gets banned in one game, there will always be another.
This.
I agree that you should be able to ban Zoe, but if your teammate has her hovered and you ban her without even communicating, you are an asshole period.

Riot agrees that I can ban whatever I please for any reason. How you feel about my decision is up to you and I can't change that.

I will always ban Zoe.

My own personal feelings on the matter may be very unpopular but...

I think anyone's desire to play a specific champion shouldn't outweigh my right to ban whichever champion I want. You can take into account any number of factors: how new a champ is, how broken and toxic to the meta a champ might be, not wanting that champion picked by the enemy before my team has a chance to pick it, genuinely not wanting that champion on my team, the fact that people should take into account the picks and bans ahead of them before blindly deciding which champion they're going to play regardless of how the team comp turns out...

Everyone gets one ban. Period. There should never be restrictions on what you can or can't ban. 

And if you're super concerned about getting to play a very specific champ in your next game, and that champ happens to have an especially high pick/ban rate, you're probably better off in blind pick anyway.

I agree somewhat but this isn't just about some high ban-rate pick, it's about banning your own teams pick. I'm not concerned about your right to ban or not, what i'm talking about is a way to kick players in champion select for not just banning, but for holding the champ select hostage because they got auto filled or their champ was banned by the enemy. So, I'm not asking about personal feelings on a champion ban, i'm instead suggesting a way to kick off assholes before the whole team is forced to play with them for maybe an entire hour. In my experience through league, people who do ban these high ban/ pick rate champions without any insight of their lane, end up feeding. So cheers to that mate :)
-Botlinebling
They wouldn't know that their champ had been banned by the enemy come time for their ban. Perhaps they just don't like Yasuo. It's a very popular opinion to have apparently.
You'll get over it
You’re a dick if you ban a teammate’s champion
Sorry riots stance is everyone has a right to ban whatever they want.

please read before commenting 
thanks,
Botlinebling
